org.openadaptor.auxil.expression
Interface IExpression

All Known Implementing Classes:
Expression, RegularExpression
public interface IExpression

Common interface for openadaptor Expressions.

In general, openadaptor expressions look like normal algebraic expressions, the difference being that the variables used within the expressions are taken as placeholders for attribute values within a supplied record. Expressions operate on ISimpleRecord objects, which in turn provide implementation neutral access to underlying record attributes for use within expressions.

In addition, expression variables may have type conversion applied before they are used in expressions. This is achieved by providing an attribute type map, which provides hints as to how an attribute from a record should be treated if it being referenced in the expression For examples of expressions in use, see the examples included with openadaptor

Author:
Eddy Higgins

Method Detail

setExpression

public void setExpression(java.lang.String expression)
                   throws ExpressionException
Set the expression which will be evaluated against incoming records. If the expression is set to null, then evaluation will always return null

Parameters:
expression - String containing an expression
Throws:
ExpressionException - if the expression is not valid.

getExpression

public java.lang.String getExpression()
Get the expression which will be evaluated against incoming records.

Returns:
String containing an expression

getAttributeTypeMap

public java.util.Map getAttributeTypeMap()
This map may be used to provide type 'hints' for conversion of arguments to an expression.

For example, assume a record has a String attribute called 'price'. If we wish to do a calculation using this attribute, we can provide a map which contains an entry mapping "price" to"Double" which will have the effect of converting the price attribute to a Double value before use in the expression.

Currently mapping supports "Long","Double","String","Date". Unknown types will be converted as Strings.

Returns:
Map of attribute name to java type mappings.
See Also:
this is where the actual convertion takes place.

setAttributeTypeMap

public void setAttributeTypeMap(java.util.Map attributeTypeMap)
This map may be used to provide type 'hints' for conversion of arguments to an expression. For example, assume a record has a String attribute called 'price'. If we wish to do a calculation using this attribute, we can provide a map which contains an entry mapping "price" to"Double" which will have the effect of converting the price attribute to a Double value before use in the expression.

Currently mapping supports "Long","Double","String","Date". Unknown types will be converted as Strings.

Parameters:
attributeTypeMap -
See Also:
this is where the actual convertion takes place.

setShortCircuitEvaluation

public void setShortCircuitEvaluation(boolean enabled)
Flag to indicate if short-circuit expression evaluation should be applied.

The default value should be true if the implementation supports it.

Parameters:
enabled - short circuit evaluation is enabled if this is true

getShortCircuitEvaluation

public boolean getShortCircuitEvaluation()
Flag to indicate if short-circuit expression evaluation should be applied.

The default value should be true if the implementation supports it.

Returns:
true if short circuit evaluation is enabled.

getThrowExceptionOnMissingAttribute

public boolean getThrowExceptionOnMissingAttribute()
Get flag which indicates if an exception should be thrown when an attribute is referenced within an expression, but doesn't exist within the ISimpleRecord instance.

Implementation note: It should default this to false, whereby references should just return null instead.

Returns:
boolean true means throw exception. False means return nulls.

setThrowExceptionOnMissingAttribute

public void setThrowExceptionOnMissingAttribute(boolean throwExceptionOnMissingAttribute)
Set flag which indicates if an exception should be thrown when an attribute is referenced within an expression, but doesn't exist within the ISimpleRecord instance.

Implementation note: It should default this to false, whereby references should just return null instead. The exception thrown should be an instance of RecordException

Parameters:
throwExceptionOnMissingAttribute - Boolean flag to indicate that an exception should be thrown when an expression refers to an attribute which does not exist within the record.

evaluate

public java.lang.Object evaluate(ISimpleRecord record)
                          throws RecordException
Evaluate the expression using the supplied record (an ISimpleRecord) to supply variable values.

Note that if the expression itself is null, then this should return null.
If the supplied record is null then an ExpressionException may be thrown, but only if the expression contains any attribute references (as they cannot be resolved).

Parameters:
record - an instance of ISimpleRecord
Returns:
Object containing the result of the expression, or null if the expression is null.
Throws:
RecordException - if the expression fails to evaluate.
